thread.title: The Sargento Cheese Recall: Everything You Need to Know
thread.title_full: The Sargento Cheese Recall: Everything You Need to Know | Epicurious.com

author: Joe Sevier
title: The Sargento Cheese Recall: Everything You Need to Know
text:
Over the weekend, Sargento recalled seven of their sliced and shredded cheeses due to reports of a possible listeria contamination. Luckily, no actual listeria outbreaks connected to the cheese have been reported so far. Two cheeses were recalled when Deutsch Kase Haus, LLC, a supplier of Sargento's Longhorn Colby cheese, notified Sargento of the potential contamination. Five more cheeses, listed below, were recalled because they were processed on the same line as the two primary cheeses in question. A representative from Sargento said that these additional cheeses were recalled "out of an abundance of caution."
Here's what you need to know:
7 Cheeses Have Been Recalled Two cheeses—6.84-oz packages of Sargento Ultra Thin Sliced Longhorn Colby (UPC 4610000228) with "Sell By" dates of "12APR17B" and "10MAY17B, and 8-oz. packages of Sargento Chef Blends Shredded Nacho & Taco Cheese (UPC 4610040041) with "Sell By" dates of "H14JUN17" and "H12JUL17"
Here are the remaining recalled cheeses, per Sargento's website :
Sargento Sliced Colby-Jack Cheese , 12 oz., UPC 4610000109 with “Sell By” date of “11JUN17B” Sargento Sliced Pepper Jack Cheese , 12 oz., UPC 4610000108 with “Sell By” dates of “12JUN17B”, “09JUL17B” and “10JUL17B” Sargento Chef Blends Shredded Taco Cheese , 8 oz., UPC 4610040002 with “Sell By” dates of “H14JUN17” and “F28JUN17” Sargento Off The Block Shredded Fine Cut Colby-Jack Cheese , 8 oz., UPC 4610040014 with “Sell By” date of “F05JUL17” Sargento Off The Block Shredded Fine Cut Cheddar Jack Cheese , 8 oz., UPC 4610040076 with “Sell By” date of “F05JUL17” Again, no cases of listeria have actually been reported yet. However, if you or your family have consumed any of these cheeses, and are suffering from fever, aching muscles, or stomach pains, consult a medical professional.
To find out if a cheese you've purchased is affected by the recall, visit Sargento's website and use the UPC or sell by date listed on the package to search their database or call Sargento at 1-800-CHEESES (1-800-243-3737).
Some salads were recalled as well In addition to the cheese recall, Taylor Farms , for whom Sargento supplies shredded pepperjack cheese, has recalled 10.5-oz packages of Signature Cafe Southwest Chicken Premade Salad with use by dates, "2/13/17, 2/14/17, or 2/15/17;" 10.5-oz packages of Signature Cafe Southwest Style Salad With Chicken with use by dates, "2/14/17, 2/15/17, or 2/16/17;" and 10.5-oz packages of H-E-B Shake Rattle & Bowl Rowdy Ranch Hand containing pork with use by dates, "2/17/17, 2/18/17, or 2/19/17." These ready-made salads were shipped to distribution centers in Los Angeles and Tracy, California; Portland, Oregon; and Houston, Roanoke and San Antonio, Texas.
All products listed should be thrown away or returned to the place of purchase.
